data.title: Beasley Broadcast places upsized 5-year secured notes to yield 8.625%; terms
data.meta_description: Proceeds will be used to repay debt and for general corporate purposes.
data.text:
Beasley Broadcast Group Inc. has priced $300 million (upsized from $280 million) of five-year senior secured notes tight of guidance, sources said. Goldman Sachs and BofA Securities were bookrunners for the deal.

Proceeds will be used to repay the company's revolving credit facility, term loan, promissory note and George Beasley loan. Any remaining proceeds will be used to provide additional cash to the balance sheet.

Beasley Broadcast Group operates radio stations in the United States. The company's wholly owned subsidiary Beasley Mezzanine Holdings LLC is the issuing entity for the debt. The new print adds bonds to the companyâ€™s capital structure. Terms:
